Package io.wcm.caravan.rhyme.spring.api

Interface SpringRhyme

public interface SpringRhyme
A request-scoped Component that you need to inject into your controllers if you want to load remote resources from an upstream service, or control the max-age cache-control directive of the response that you are rendering. This component wraps the same Rhyme instance that is also used to render the server-side resource implementations that you return in your RestController methods.

    Description

    Enables support for timestamp-based URL fingerprinting for the current request.
    io.wcm.caravan.rhyme.api.Rhyme
    getCoreRhyme()
    Provides access to the underlying Rhyme instance of the core framework to be used for the current request, just in case you need to call one of the methods for which there doesn't exist a delegate in the SpringRhyme interface

    Create a dynamic client proxy to load HAL+JSON resources from an upstream service (using the core framework's HalApiClient)

    Limit the maximum time for which the response should be cached by clients and downstream services.

  • Method Details

    • getRemoteResource

      <T> T getRemoteResource(String uri, Class<T> halApiInterface)
      Create a dynamic client proxy to load HAL+JSON resources from an upstream service (using the core framework's HalApiClient)
      Type Parameters:
      T - an interface annotated with HalApiInterface
      Parameters:
      uri - the fully qualified URI of the entry point
      halApiInterface - an interface annotated with HalApiInterface
      Returns:
      a dynamic proxy instance of the provided HalApiInterface that you can use to navigate through the resources of the service
      See Also:
      • HalApiClient

    • setResponseMaxAge

      void setResponseMaxAge(Duration duration)
      Limit the maximum time for which the response should be cached by clients and downstream services. Note that calling this method only sets the upper limit: if other upstream resource fetched during the current request indicate a lower max-age value in their header, that lower value will be used instead.
      Parameters:
      duration - the max cache time

    • enableUrlFingerprinting

      UrlFingerprinting enableUrlFingerprinting()
      Enables support for timestamp-based URL fingerprinting for the current request.
      Returns:
      a UrlFingerprinting instance that you need to configure and then use to build the links for all resources in your project
      See Also:
      • UrlFingerprinting

    • getCoreRhyme

      io.wcm.caravan.rhyme.api.Rhyme getCoreRhyme()
      Provides access to the underlying Rhyme instance of the core framework to be used for the current request, just in case you need to call one of the methods for which there doesn't exist a delegate in the SpringRhyme interface
      Returns:
      the single Rhyme instance that is used throughout the incoming request
